intro: Entelea bakeri, commonly known as the Baker's entelea, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
